section.name: Howto run the Messenger on the Laptop
section.p: You can start the Messenger application with runpeer.sh on Linux, for Windows use runpeer.bat.

section.name: Howto run the Messenger on the IPAQ
section.p: Make sure you have a java virtual machine installed on your iPaq. You can use the j9 jvm. Copy the ipaq directory to your iPaq. Check that the information about the location of your jvm are correct in the run-ppcj9.lnk file. You can start the Messenger application by selecting the run-ppcj9.lnk shortcut.

section.name: Howto run the Messenger MIDlet on the mobile device

li.p: Copy the files im-gui-handygui.jar and im-gui-handygui.jad to your mobile device.
For example on Windows you can use the Send a File Option of your bluetooth device. The file will then be copied to the messaging folder of your mobile phone.
Select the jad-file and follow the installation proccess.
Never select the JAR file! Always use the JAD file. Otherwise your application will not work.

ol.li: You can start the Messenger application by clicking on the Messenger shortcut.

section.p: More detailed information on how to install MIDlets on a mobile phone can be found in the documentation of the Smartmessenger

section.name: Howto run the Messenger MIDlet with the WTK2.1 simulator

li.p: Create a new project with the Project Name jadabs-im-handygui and MIDlet Class Name Messenger
This will result in an error, but simply ignore that
Copy the following files into the folder \WTK2.1\apps\im-gui-handygui\bin
Copy the folder classes into the folder \WTK2.1\apps\im-gui-handygui
Select Run via OTA in the Project panel
Now you can start the Messenger application by selecting the Messenger shortcut.
